data.text: @galinash @susanne_nystrom Och "De bästa (och billigaste) sjukdomarna är trots allt de som aldrig bryter ut eller behöver behandlas." JA, jag tror de som fått långtgående men efter en infektion håller med. Jag har en dyr sjukdom, som ofta kan sättas i samband med en infektion (EBV).

@galinash @susanne_nystrom Alltså, wtf: " Coronaviruset skapade långt ifrån ett nytt folkhälsoproblem. Det underströk bara riskerna med fysisk inaktivitet och ohälsosamma matvanor samt utökade omfattningen." Visst, hon åsyftar att stillasittande o fetma redan var problem innan.. men...

@galinash In Germany also. But we ask during pandemic...  hm... philosopher maybe, not WW. 😏

Even - to admit that - from the moment on they decided that pandemic is finally over, some journalists allow themselves to talk about LC. But "damage through inexistance" done already.
@trifan_tatiana @susanne_nystrom The inequality aspect and communication aspect is something that's out of US 90s, the way it's presented here right now.
@trifan_tatiana @susanne_nystrom Oh it's total fat shaming. She could have talked to someone who's an actual expert on this.
Swedish journalists and non-existent källkritik when confirmation bias is engaged.

OMG the article quotes as expert on this someone from Weight Watchers. Maybe (?) there's a trend (from before the pandemic notes even this article), but you don't ask about it a for profit company that sells weight loss. Also self-reporting? Really?

https://t.co/WIUpRmw2YW

Meantime, accepted research conclusions from the last 2y are that COVID about doubles chances of diabetes and increases the cardiovascular disease. Anyone who makes a broad claim like below needs to separate the two effects. https://t.co/riz3Yvwv47
